question: It is true that an ecosystem consists of both living and non-living components interacting in a specific environment.
It is false that biotic components of an ecosystem include air, water, and sunlight.
It is true that a pond is considered an ecosystem because it supports interactions between fish, algae, and water.
It is false that an ecosystem only includes living organisms and does not involve any physical environment.
It is true that ecosystems can be divided into natural and artificial types.
It is false that forests, grasslands, and deserts are examples of artificial ecosystems.
It is true that an aquarium is a type of artificial ecosystem.
It is false that energy flow in an ecosystem begins with animals.
It is true that the Sun is the primary source of energy in an ecosystem.
It is false that food chains and food webs do not exist in an ecosystem.
It is true that a food chain represents the flow of energy from one organism to another.
It is false that deserts are not considered ecosystems because they lack water.
It is true that decomposers help in breaking down dead plants and animals in an ecosystem.
It is false that nutrient cycling does not occur in an ecosystem.
It is true that forests help regulate the climate by absorbing carbon dioxide.
It is false that human activities do not affect ecosystems in any way.
It is true that artificial ecosystems require human management to function properly.
It is false that marine ecosystems only include fish and do not have any plants or microorganisms.
It is true that oxygen is an essential abiotic component in an ecosystem.
It is false that the balance of gases in an ecosystem is not important for survival.
It is true that forests are self-sustaining ecosystems.
It is false that a desert ecosystem does not have any living organisms.
It is true that the water cycle plays a significant role in ecosystems.
It is false that food chains always remain the same and do not change over time.
It is true that interdependence is a key characteristic of ecosystems.
It is false that the loss of bees would not affect plant pollination in an ecosystem.
It is true that terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems are two broad divisions of natural ecosystems.
It is false that climate change has no effect on ecosystems.
It is true that ecosystems maintain the balance of nature by cycling nutrients and energy.
It is false that all ecosystems have the same climate and biodiversity.
